title: How to Refurbish a Teddy Bear

steps.title: If your bear does not already have a hole in a seam through which the stuffing can be removed, very carefully open a straight seam (such as the back seam) by cutting the seam thread with a pair of scissors, a very sharp knife, or a seam ripper.
steps.content: If your bear does not already have a hole in a seam through which the stuffing can be removed, very carefully open a straight seam (such as the back seam) by cutting the seam thread with a pair of scissors, a very sharp knife, or a seam ripper. Remove all of the stuffing and discard. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Very gently hand-wash the now empty fur in warm water with a mild laundry detergent.
steps.content: Very gently hand-wash the now empty fur in warm water with a mild laundry detergent. Rinse well with warm water. Repeat these steps as necessary, until the wash water no longer becomes coloured with the dirt that may come out of the fur. Gently squeeze (do not wring) the fur to remove most of the water. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Remove the excess water by placing an old towel on the floor, placing the bear on the towel, folding the towel over the bear, then standing on it.
steps.content: Remove the excess water by placing an old towel on the floor, placing the bear on the towel, folding the towel over the bear, then standing on it. This will squeeze excess water from the fur without wringing it, which could damage the fabric. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Blow dry the bear with a blow dryer, being careful not to scorch the fur.
steps.content: Blow dry the bear with a blow dryer, being careful not to scorch the fur. Allow it to further air dry overnight to ensure the seams are completely dry.

steps.title: Tease out the matted knots if the bear's fur was matted, after the bear is dry.
steps.content: Tease out the matted knots if the bear's fur was matted, after the bear is dry. A dental pick works well. Work the pick through the knots, being careful not to pull the fur out.

steps.title: Turn the teddy bear inside out to examine each seam for holes and to examine the thread which may be, if the teddy bear is very old, weak and rotten.
steps.content: Turn the teddy bear inside out to examine each seam for holes and to examine the thread which may be, if the teddy bear is very old, weak and rotten. Sew the holes closed and reinforce the seams as needed, using either a needle and thread or a sewing machine. If a needle and thread is used, be sure to place the stitches close together and pull each stitch tight. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Turn the bear right side out.
steps.content: Turn the bear right side out. Examine the seams and areas you've stitched to ensure the seams are tight and the stitches are invisible from the outside. Tight seams are crucial!

steps.title: Replace missing eyes if necessary.
steps.content: Replace missing eyes if necessary. Buttons work well.

steps.title: Fill each of the legs and arms using a ball of polyester fiberfill approximately 6 times the size of the volume of the cavity to be filled, packing each very tightly.
steps.content: Fill each of the legs and arms using a ball of polyester fiberfill approximately 6 times the size of the volume of the cavity to be filled, packing each very tightly. Using one ball for each arm and leg is better than filling them with many smaller balls of fiberfill. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Fill the head and body cavity, using one large clump of fiberfill for each.
steps.content: Fill the head and body cavity, using one large clump of fiberfill for each. Pack tightly, ensuring there is enough fiberfill to make the arm, leg and neck joints firm.

steps.title: Sew the seam closed that you've packed the fiberfill through.
steps.content: Sew the seam closed that you've packed the fiberfill through.

steps.title: Comb the fur to make it fluffy.
steps.content: Comb the fur to make it fluffy.

steps.title: Dress your teddy in nice, clean clothes, if you and (s)he agree on it.
steps.content: Dress your teddy in nice, clean clothes, if you and (s)he agree on it.

steps.title: Take care of your newly refurbished teddy.
steps.content: Take care of your newly refurbished teddy. It'll be good for decades to come.
